item.title: Tips to Speed Up Data Pump Imports into Autonomous Database (ADB)
item.description:
Many DBAs prefer using Oracle Data Pump when migrating data into Autonomous Database (ADB), largely because the tool is familiar and reliable. However, Data Pump imports can become slow and resource-intensive, especially when migrating databases larger than a few 100 GB. In one customer case I was involved in, a 650â€¯GB import into ADB took 18 hours to complete - clearly a pain point.

A few simple adjustments can dramatically reduce import times and make the overall migration process smoother.

item.title: Running DBCA in GUI Mode on an OCI Linux VM
item.description:
When working with Oracle databases on OCI Linux VMs, you may want to run Database Configuration Assistant (DBCA) in GUI mode instead of command-line mode.
This requires a GNOME desktop environment, a VNC session, and optionally SSH tunneling for secure access.

Prerequisites

Before testing DBCA in GUI mode, ensure the following:

  • A GNOME desktop environment is installed on the OCI VM. GUI applications like DBCA require a desktop environment to display.
  • A VNC server (e.g., tigervnc-server) is installed and running on the OCI VM.
  • A VNC client (such as RealVNC, TightVNC, or TigerVNC Viewer) is installed on your local desktop or laptop.
  • If you use SSH tunneling to access VNC, you do NOT need to open any VNC ports on the VM externally â€” the tunnel handles secure forwarding and all traffic is handled through the SSH port 22.
  • If youâ€™re connecting directly over the network without using SSH tunneling, open port 5901 (for display :1) in your OCI security list and VM firewall. This is NOT recommended because the traffic between your laptop and the VM is unencrypted.

item.title: Quick Guide: Connect to ExaCS in a private subnet from SQL Developer on your laptop
item.description:
1. Prerequisites

  • SSH key (id_rsa) configured.
  • Bastion session (SSH Port forwarding) details ready.
  • SQL Developer installed.

Reference: Bastion Concepts (https://docs.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/Content/Bastion/Concepts/bastionoverview.htm)

2. Port Forwarding Command

Forward local port 1521 to the ExaCS VM:

ssh -v -i id_rsa -N -L 1521:<EXACS_VM_IP>:1521 -p 22 <BASTION_SESSION_OCID>

Explanation

  • -v â†’ verbose mode (for debugging)
  • -i id_rsa â†’ use your SSH key
  • -N â†’ no remote shell command, just forward ports
  • -L 1521:<EXACS_VM_IP>:1521 â†’ forward local port 1521 to the VMâ€™s 1521 port
  • -p 22 â†’ SSH port for the Bastion

Keep this terminal session open while connecting from SQL Developer.
